name: Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ all drawings are the latest revision.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Record of conformity - Site and Office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation Permit issued by APAM obtained prior to any excavation on site.
Record of conformity - Proof of permit & ITP signed
○ 100mm Dia slotted with filter fabric (sock) CL1000 SN20.
○ AGL Carrier Pipe: 80mm Dia PN12 uPVC Non-Perforated Pipe.
○ SSD Carrier Pipe: 150mm Dia PN12 uPVC Non-Perforated Pipe.
Reference Documents - Cl.16.5.3, Cl.16.5.4 & IFC Drawings
Record of conformity - Order Inspection Checklist
Acceptance Criteria - Subsoil Drain Pipes Under Pavement
○ Holcim’s 5mm Moriac Sand or approved equivalent.
○ Holcim’s 5mm Moriac Sand or approved equivalent.
Reference Documents - IFC Drawings & VicRoads Section 702
Record of conformity - Visual Inspection & Delivery Docket
Acceptance Criteria - Non-woven type complying with the requirements of VicRoads for first stage filter.
Record of conformity - Visual Inspection & Delivery Docket
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches shall be excavated to the minimum depths, widths and batter slopes as shown on the drawings.
– 300mm total width for the subsoil drain pipe (DN100).
– Horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench to be minimum of 150mm for all collector pipes (DN80 & DN150 both under pavement and in grassed areas).
○ Excavated material disposed per approved CEMP.
○ Completed excavation works shall constitute a Hold Point.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - Geotextiles in trench drains shall be placed to conform loosely to the shape of the trenches. The approved geotextile must fully envelope the drainage material in the trench with a minimum 150mm lap. Cover the placed geotextile with 50mm sand after wrapping. The geotextile placed must not have punctures or tears and, if these occur, they must be rectified prior to covering over.
○ Site trial to be undertaken to evaluate the proposed construction process and compaction method, Hold Point.
Reference Documents - Cl.16.9.4.2, Cl.16.9.4.5 & IFC Drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding for Subsoil Drain Pipes Under Pavement and Subsoil Collector Pipes in Grass
○ Filter material shall be placed and compacted with minimum disturbance to pipes and in layers no greater than 200mm uncompacted.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - Pipes laid at the depths and lines indicated on the drawings. Where grades are not specified, the bottom of the trenches shall be trimmed to provide no less than 0.5% longitudinal fall.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill for Subsoil Drain Pipe (⌀100mm pipe)
– Granular filter material backfill is to be placed to the underside of the CTB layer.
○ Backfill for Subsoil Collector pipe ⌀150mm Under Pavement
– 5MPa lean mix backfill is to be placed to a minimum of 150mm above the pipe crown to underside of pavement formation.
– Backfill to be completed in two stages to avoid pipe floatation.
○ Backfill for Subsoil Collector pipe ⌀150mm In Grassed Areas
– Granular filter material is to be placed to a minimum of 150mm above the pipe crown.
– Excavated soil recompacted in layers not exceeding 200mm loose thickness to underside of topsoil.
– 5MPa lean mix backfill to be placed to be placed to top of 150mm FCR subbase layer
– Backfill to be completed in two stages to avoid pipe floatation.
Reference Documents - Cl.16.9.2, IFC Drawings & Tender Clarification #38
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Subsoil outlet point to be located at a drainage pit, pipe end wall or outlet in a fill batter or drain. All subsoil drain outlets shall be fitted with Vermin Guards.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Cleanouts shall be located at the heads of all subsoil drains and as specified on the Drawings.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - Flushing test to be carried out for subsoil pipes to remove material that has entered the pipes during construction and to ensure that the drainage line is free from obstruction. This constitutes a Witness Point.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Levels and alignment recorded in as built documentation.
Record of conformity - Aconex Correspondence / Asbuilts
